title: St Andrew's Day
caption: A misty Saltire for St Andrew’s Day
desc: These low-lying clouds reflected in Loch Chon have created a misty Saltire – the perfect picture to see in St Andrew's Day and celebrate Scotland’s patron saint. Today, 30 November, marks the start of Scotland’s three winter festivals – the others being Hogmanay and Burns Night – and is celebrated with traditional food and drink, music and dancing. St Andrew is patron saint of a number of countries including Russia and Romania and there are various stories about how he ended up being patron saint of Scotland. One involves a 9th Century king of the Picts, Oengus II, who saw white clouds form an “X” in the sky before battle against the Angles – a bit like our homepage image today. It was taken as a sign and he vowed that if he won the battle, he would make St Andrew the patron saint of Scotland. He did!
